Class ActionCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • ActionCard
  • public class ActionCard
extends java.lang.Object
    JAVADOC This class is for action cards. It includes the mainID which is used to identify a card (see below). It also includes the type of card and description details for each card.

    All action cards are stored using stack implementation. The head always starts at tne very last index 49 (to represent the top card in real life). Whenever an Action Card is drawn, return the top most card, then decrement head. If the deck of Action cards run out, shuffle, then reset head back to the last index 49. Below are the mainID details

    0 - Collect from the Bank

    1 - Pay the Bank

    2 - Pay the Player

    3 - Collect From Player

    Each Action Card also has a subID that is used to further identify an action card (see below).

    If ID = 0 (Collect from bank) -> subID 0 - Tax refund, 1 - Sell an Item, 2 - Bonus Payday, 3 - Setup school

    If ID = 1 (Pay the Bank) -> subID 0 - Buy an Item, 1 - Visit a Place, 2 - Hiking, 3 - Watch a Show, 4 - Win a Competiton, 5 - Traffic Violation

    If ID = 2 (Pay the Player) -> subID 0 - Lawsuit (choose a Player), 1 - Christmas Bonus (pay all players)

    If ID = 3 (Collect from Player)-> subID 0 - File a Lawsuit (choose a player), 1 - It's Your Birthday (collect from all players)

    Author:
    gabby

    • Method Detail

      • generateSubID

        public void generateSubID()
        This randomly generates a subID for an Action Card based on its mainID (see below)

        If ID = 0 (Collect from bank) -> subID 0 - Tax refund, 1 - Sell an Item, 2 - Bonus Payday, 3 - Setup school

        If ID = 1 (Pay the Bank) -> subID 0 - Buy an Item, 1 - Visit a Place, 2 - Hiking, 3 - Watch a Show, 4 - Win a Competiton, 5 - Traffic Violation

        If ID = 2 (Pay the Player) -> subID 0 - Lawsuit (choose a Player), 1 - Christmas Bonus (pay all players)

        If ID = 3 (Collect from Player)-> subID 0 - File a Lawsuit (choose a player), 1 - It's Your Birthday (collect from all players)

      • assignDescriptions

        public void assignDescriptions​(int mainID)
        This method automatically assigns the type of card and its description for each Action Card based on its mainID
        Parameters:
        mainID - mainID of an Action Card

      • doAction

        public void doAction​(Player[] players,
                     int turn,
                     int numberOfPlayersInGame)
        This method is responsible for executing an Action Cards instructions based on its mainID.
        Parameters:
        players - the players of the game
        turn - current player turn (e.g Player 1's turn, value is 0; Player 2's turn, value is 1)
        numberOfPlayersInGame - total number of players in game

      • top

        public static ActionCard top​(java.util.ArrayList<ActionCard> deck)
        Returns the topmost card (pointed by the head).
        Parameters:
        deck - Action Card deck to get the topmost card from
        Returns:
        the topmost card

      • pop

        public static ActionCard pop​(java.util.ArrayList<ActionCard> deck)
        Returns the topmost card and shifts the head (decrement). If the head is 0, return the last card, then automatically shuffle the deck and reset the head value to 49.
        Parameters:
        deck - Action Card deck to get the topmost card from
        Returns:
        the topmost card

      • setHead

        public static void setHead​(int num)
        Manually sets the head value for the stack implementation of the Action Card deck. This is only called on -ac (limited action card) terminal argument is made on program run.
        Parameters:
        num - specified head value to set to

      • getMainID

        public int getMainID()
        Returns the action card's mainID value
        Returns:
        mainID value of an action card

        Returns:
        String representation of the type of the action card
